data.title: Nobel: Literature
data.meta_description: Italian playwright Dario Fo - a popular figure whose plays are often produced in the streets - was awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature. Fo's take: "I am flabbergasted." Shocked or not, he gets the US$1 million prize for, in the Swedish Academy's words, "emulating the jesters of the Middle Ages in scourging authority and upholding the dignity of the downtrodden."
